meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to become insane or irrational.
meanings.sent1: The scary movie was so deranging that it gave me nightmares.
meanings.sent2: The loud noises outside were deranging the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog is deranging but also quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news was like a deranging storm in her calm life.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was deranging, making her heart race.

meanings.definition: Disturb the normal operation or function of (something).
meanings.sent1: The power outage was deranging the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The virus was deranging the computer system, causing it to crash repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was deranging the picnic by stealing all the food.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in weather deranged our plans for a sunny day at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The loud construction noise was deranging the peace and quiet of the countryside.
